org.prop4j.explain.solvers

Interface MutableSatSolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SatProblem, SatSolver
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MusExtractor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ltms, Sat4jAllMusExtractor, Sat4jMusExtractor, Sat4jMutableSatSolver

    public interface MutableSatSolver
extends SatSolver

    A SAT solver which is completely mutable. Clauses can not only be added but also removed.

    The SAT solver is be interpreted as a stack of scopes with increasing locality. Each push makes the solver enter a new scope, grouping together any number of clauses. All of them are removed simultaneously when the scope is exited with the next pop. This way, clauses can be removed without having to keep handles to them. Instead, it only matters which scope they are in. Indeed, it is not necessary to be able to locate and remove clauses from the middle of the solver. On the other hand, the evaluation must take all scopes into account.
    Author:
    Timo Günther

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Node> pop()
      Exits the current scope for a less local one.
      void push()
      Enters a more local scope.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.prop4j.explain.solvers.SatSolver

        getModel, getOracle, isSatisfiable

      • Methods inherited from interface org.prop4j.explain.solvers.SatProblem

        addAssumption, addAssumptions, addFormula, addFormulas, addFormulas, containsClause, getAssumption, getAssumptions, getClause, getClauseCount, getClauses, getClauses

    • Method Detail

      • push

        void push()
        Enters a more local scope. The next pop will remove all clauses of the newest instead of the old scope.

      • pop

        java.util.List<Node> pop()
                  throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Exits the current scope for a less local one. Removes all clauses that have been added since the last push.
        Returns:
        the removed clauses; not null
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no stack levels left
